bill_title: to define child abuse and provide a penalty therefor.

bill_versions.bill_text: FOR AN ACT ENTITLED, An Act to define child abuse and provide a penalty therefor. BE IT ENACTED BY THE LEGISLATURE OF THE STATE OF SOUTH DAKOTA: Section 1. No person may cause or permit a minor to be: (1) Placed in a situation that endangers the minor's life or physical or mental health; (2) Cruelly confined or cruelly punished; (3) Deprived of necessary food, clothing, shelter, or care; (4) Placed in a situation to be sexually exploited by allowing, encouraging, or forcing the minor to solicit for or engage in prostitution, debauchery, public indecency, or obscene or pornographic photography, films, or depictions; or (5) Placed in a situation to be sexually abused. A violation of this section committed negligently is a Class 1 misdemeanor. A violation of this section committed knowingly and intentionally which does not result in serious bodily injury is a Class 4 felony. A violation of this section committed knowingly and intentionally which results in serious bodily injury is a Class 3 felony. A violation of this section committed knowingly and intentionally which results in the death of a minor is a Class 1 felony. Section 2. The statutory privilege between patient and physician, between client and professional counselor, and between husband and wife is not available for excluding or refusing testimony in any prosecution for a violation of section 1 of this Act. Section 3. That § 26-10-1 be repealed. 26-10-1. Any person who abuses, exposes, tortures, torments or cruelly punishes a minor in a manner which does not constitute aggravated assault, is guilty of a Class 4 felony.
